Theophilus of Corte | image = Alando st Théophile de Corte.jpg | imagesize = | alt = | caption = | titles = Priest | birth_date = 30 October 1676 | birth_place = [[Corte, Haute-Corse|Corte]], [[Corsica]], [[Republic of Genoa]] | death_date = {{death date and age|1740|06|17|1676|10|30|df=yes}} | death_place = Corte, Corsica, [[Republic of Genoa]] | venerated_in = [[Roman Catholic Church]] | beatified_date = 19 January 1896 | beatified_place = [[Saint Peter's Basilica]], [[Kingdom of Italy]] | beatified_by = [[Pope Leo XIII]] | canonized_date = 29 June 1930 | canonized_place = Saint Peter's Basilica, [[Vatican City]] | canonized_by = [[Pope Pius XI]] | major_shrine = | feast_day = 19 May | attributes = Franciscan habit | patronage = | issues = | suppressed_date = | suppressed_by = | influences = | influenced = | tradition = | major_works = }} [[Canonization|Saint]] '''Theophilus of Corte''' (30 October 1676 – 17 June 1740) was a [[Roman Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] friar born as '''Biagio Arrighi''' in [[Corsica]] in the [[Republic of Genoa]]. He was born into a rich household and his parents were [[Nobility|nobles]]. He studied under the [[Franciscan Order|Franciscans]] in 1693 and was assigned to a Franciscan [[Retreat (spiritual)|retreat house]] after his [[ordination]] into the [[Priesthood (Catholic Church)|priesthood]] in [[Naples]].http://www.catholic.org/saints/saint.php?saint_id=2269 He was a [[wikt:reformer|reformer]] who become known for his [[preaching]] and evangelization efforts and also established other retreat houses throughout Corsica and [[Tuscany]].http://www.americancatholic.org/Features/SaintOfDay/default.asp?id=1388 He was [[Beatification|beatified]] on 19 January 1896 by [[Pope Leo XIII]] and was [[canonized]] as a [[Roman Catholic saint|saint]] of the Roman Catholic Church by [[Pius XI]] on 29 June 1930. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Theophilus Of Corte}} [[Category:18th-century Christian saints]] [[Category:Beatifications by Pope Leo XIII]] [[Category:Canonizations by Pope Pius XI]] [[Category:Italian Franciscans]] [[Category:Italian Roman Catholic saints]] [[Category:1676 births]] [[Category:1740 deaths]] [[Category:People from Corte, Haute-Corse]] [[Category:French nobility]] [[Category:17th-century French people]] [[Category:italian Roman Catholic missionaries]] [[Category:Italian Roman Catholic priests]] [[Category:Reformers]] [[Category:18th-century French people]] [[Category:Roman Catholic missionaries in Europe]] [[Category:Franciscan missionaries]] {{Saint-stub}}
